website_summaries.verdict: The Nvidia GTX 650 Ti Boost graphics card offers substantially better performance at a great price.
pros: Substantially  faster than other mainstream graphics cards

customer_reviews.title: Good performance.
customer_reviews.text: I've had this for awhile and it seems to be holding up very well. That's what I go by, along with the performance and software, which seem to be very good. The driver software now lets you capture game activity. In other words, you can turn on this capture feature in the driver when you start to play a game and the software will create a perfect AVI video of all your game activity. I use this to capture the activity with my Phoenix Flight Simulator and it does a perfect job. Update: I bought this on 11-07-12 and it's 02-08-15. The video card is still going strong. The NVIDIA GeForce Experience software that comes with it is very good.
customer_reviews.author: FlatPicker

customer_reviews.title: I'm loving it!
customer_reviews.text: So I've been toying with the idea of building my own gaming PC for over a year. It was after hours of playing Skyrim on the PS3 that sealed the deal. I did extensive research, and found that this EVGA product (like all their others) has a great performance temp (42C) and would handle Skyrim quite nicely. I purchased this and put it on a system running the following: MSI B75MA-E33 Intel Core i3-3220 Corsair Vengeance 8 GB RAM Cooler Master eXtreme Power Plus 500w Power Supply Win 7 64x SanDisk Extreme SSD 120 GB Boots in 12 seconds, Runs Skyrim on Max Settings @ 1080p 60htz around 42C all day long. I would recommend this card to you.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: Excellent mid-range card.
customer_reviews.text: Installed this quick and easy. Didn't use the included drivers on the CD based on previous reviews; just downloaded straight from the site. No issues, working great. Most games I can now push to top graphics settings and get ~40 fps, which is acceptable. I prefer just running one notch below top, get 60 fps and absolutely no lag/skipping at all. I've used EVGA cards in the last 8 systems I've built (3 of my own, 5 for friends/customers), and have never had a problem. Flat-out excellent build quality, tools, and support. System: Core i3 2.93ghz overclocked to 3.5ghz 8GB 1666 DDR3 Crucial M3 64gb SSD, 640gb Western Digital Caviar Black 7200rpm HD
customer_reviews.author: C. I.

customer_reviews.title: Great price for a BEAST of a GPU
customer_reviews.text: I can play crysis 3 with all graphics settings maxxed and still get a solid 20 fps (also running 8GB RAM and a 3.2Ghz i5)... This is a beast of a card with a great price that will chew up everything except the most extreme graphical requirements for games you throw at it. Even those high end games will run butter smooth... you may just have to settle for high settings instead of ultra settings. I expect to be using this baby for at least 3 years... probably more like 5.
customer_reviews.author: M. J. Thornton

customer_reviews.title: Great for Older Hardware
customer_reviews.text: I built my hobby computer around 4 years ago. The hardware was still going strong. My average cost per year on the ownership was $200 per year, so I bought this card and a memory upgrade - it was like having a new PC. The motherboard I use has a PCIe 2.0 slot, and this card is backwards compatible with my system. I found CNET's review of this product very helpful when I was on the fence about it - but have not regretted the purchase in the least.
customer_reviews.author: James P.

customer_reviews.title: DESKTOP: Great Video! Audio Problems
customer_reviews.text: I found that this item has great video and will send sound thru the HDMI, but after installing it, I have had problems with my "ON-BOARD" sound. I can NOT get the on-board sound to work. I even tried turning off the on-board sound, installing a separate sound card & run into the same problem... No sound from the card. Still out on this item Rick Bearse
customer_reviews.author: Richard T. Bearse

customer_reviews.title: Best graphic card for a 400watts PSU
customer_reviews.text: I did a lot of research for graphics cards that require a minimum of 400watts of power supplu capacity and this one looks like the best one you can find. However, If you have a PSU of 450watts or bigger, go and buy the GTX 660Ti. It performs a lot better. For the price and my system limitations, this is a good choice for everyone.
customer_reviews.author: Joseann J. Robles

customer_reviews.title: Works great. 60+ FPS.
customer_reviews.text: Still getting 60+ FPS on top graphix modes on all the games I play. World of Tanks, Mass Effect Trilogy, Left for Dead 2. Nothing even bothers this thing. Hot summer days the fan will run like a banshee, but never any problems.
customer_reviews.author: PrettyPen422

customer_reviews.title: EVGA wont stand behind their products.
customer_reviews.text: Cooling fan failed during warranty period, rendering the card useless. Despite multiple requests from EVGA for an RMA they have not seemed to be too interested in standing behind their product. I will be avoiding this brand from now on.
customer_reviews.author: JimZ

customer_reviews.title: Can't be the quality for price
customer_reviews.text: I purchased the EVGA GTX 650 TI to replace 2 SLI 9800 GT cards in my Alienware computer. I needed to run DirectX 11 and I didn't want to spend a lot of money for a new card. I can run Far Cry 3 and Crysis 3 (DirectX 11 required) on very high settings. It was well worth the money and I would recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Albert J. Mangini

customer_reviews.title: EVGA is Solid
customer_reviews.text: This is my fourth purchase of an EVGA product and this GTX 650 Ti didn't disappoint. Build quality is very good and support in the form of warranty and software is also very good. Price was very good for all you get and if you're tired of running 2+ video cards this is a great option.
customer_reviews.author: RiseToMe

customer_reviews.title: Works as advertised
customer_reviews.text: Has lasted a good while and still going strong. It's not a powerhouse card, but it gets the job done.
customer_reviews.author: Swankglove

customer_reviews.title: Windows 8 Scored 7.4
customer_reviews.text: Don't expect to get a rebate! I sent it all in and was denied, the funny part was I taped the bar code on the form, they scanned it and denied it due to bar code missing, yet you could see it in the scan they sent! Good card, not super gaming but not bad.
customer_reviews.author: Skip

customer_reviews.title: Awesome...
customer_reviews.text: This GPU is awesome. Small form factor, dual-link DVI, miniHDMI, 2GB GDDR5, and quiet. Searched different brands, features and benchmarks for an excellent GPU that was current. I wanted a card that can handle my needs (graphics and gaming) and anything else that may come way. I choose this model. It does have a mini HDMI connector which is the only compromise I made. My preference is the large style HDMI connector. However, this is not a con. I am famliar with the brand and have purchased EVGA products prior. My previous card has performed flawlessly and I don't expect or anticipate any problems with this card. EVGA will always be my first choice for GPUs.
customer_reviews.author: DJ

customer_reviews.title: Great in 2013, and in 2015... you research it.
customer_reviews.text: This thing was great in 2013. Lots of CUDA cores for a low price. Perhaps in 2015, there is a better option.
customer_reviews.author: Kyle Wilshusen

customer_reviews.title: much better than my old Geforce
customer_reviews.text: I had a 3 or 4 year old card that ran decent enough. 30fps on WOW with moderate settings. With this card I get 100fps doing casual stuff (quests, pvp, etc) during intense stuff it can go down to about 40, which is still higher than my old card, and that's with settings maxed. Good performance especially for the price. Doesn't run as hot as my old one either.
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: major improvement from ati 5450. now I just need a mobo/cpu to match and I can finally play fallout 3 and skyrim on ultra with enb mods
customer_reviews.author: customer101

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Bought it awhile ago. This review might be outdated but still working great
customer_reviews.author: Mike Metcalf

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: This is an excellent card in terms of performance, power consumption, decibel level and value, especially considering such a small form factor. I'm currently using it to run Cinema 4D and After Effects.
customer_reviews.author: Jomatecc

customer_reviews.title: Great GPU i have had the best gaming experiences with ...
customer_reviews.text: Great GPU i have had the best gaming experiences with this peace of hardware for the price back then! god bless you.
customer_reviews.author: cesar

customer_reviews.title: good buy
customer_reviews.text: This was a good buy for the price. It is a very capable video card as I can run many more games than my old card.
customer_reviews.author: TheWhizard

customer_reviews.title: I like it it has taken a licking and has kept ...
customer_reviews.text: I like it it has taken a licking and has kept on ticking, would not recommended for clocking enthusiasts
customer_reviews.author: rayg

customer_reviews.title: Excellent addition to my computer.
customer_reviews.text: This card surpassed my expectations. Little did I know my beast of a machine was stuck with a $40 video card. Once that was out and replaced by the 650 Ti, it was like i had a whole new computer. For the system I have and the card I used to use, this graphics card really stepped the game up. I can pretty much play anything on Ultra level graphics now. Totally worth the price.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel

customer_reviews.title: Great Video Card
customer_reviews.text: This card worked as expected. It delivers fast quality video display. Works well with Cycles render engine and plays high end video games at full resolution without breaking a sweat.
customer_reviews.author: William Hopper

customer_reviews.title: Nice, but not quite the bang I was expecting
customer_reviews.text: I replaced a GTX 550 Ti 1GB with this puppy. The 550 Ti had 192 stream processors (aka CUDA cores), and this one has 768 plus a gig more DDR5 GPU RAM. Given that, I expected to see more than a 1/10th of a point bump in my Windows User Experience rating, so I subtracted one star. However, I like the form factor, and actually intend this for use in micro-ATX portable case (there's no way the ASUS GTX 550 Ti was going to fit in it).
customer_reviews.author: R. Hood

customer_reviews.title: Really great graphics card
customer_reviews.text: Everything was in order. the GTX 650 TI is a great graphics card and i, as a begginer to pc gaming/building would recomend this graphics card to anyone trying to build a nice budget gaming pc, this card went into my 600-700 dollar build and it works great.
customer_reviews.author: zane

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Card
customer_reviews.text: The card worked awesome right out of the box even without any tweaking, after a little tweaking with the EVGA software it runs anything cranked up at 1600 x 1040. You won't be disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin Sr.

customer_reviews.title: Solid performance
customer_reviews.text: I bought this when I built my own computer. It has been working like a charm. I won't pretend to know which games are truly graphic intensive, because I don't play too many in the first place. But I can tell you that it handles Diablo 3, Final Fantasy XIV, Skyrim, and Sim City 5 all on the highest level of detail with no problems. I would definitely recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Llama

customer_reviews.title: For the price, I couldn't be happier.
customer_reviews.text: Renders Battlefield 3 fine and dandy, FarCry no problems. So far, so good. I've owned it for a few months now and I haven't run into any problems. Worth considering for a mid range build.
customer_reviews.author: None

customer_reviews.title: works great, but don't bother with the CD under windows 8
customer_reviews.text: This is a nice card, but ignore the instructions. Install the card, than download the latest driver from NVIDIA. If I had done that to begin with, I would have saved myself 60 minutes of waiting for the driver to load. Once the new one was downloaded, the whole process took less than 5 minutes. Now that it is in, it runs really well, takes less power, and is quiet. Its also shorter than my last card, but more powerful.
customer_reviews.author: Brad Bortner

customer_reviews.title: Good for the price
customer_reviews.text: I can tell a big difference going from my 260 to this. I can now use the high res pack for sleepy dogs!!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Working flawlessly so far
customer_reviews.text: It works great out of the box and using the Precision X software from EVGA's site I've been able to easily overclock it. I maxed out every single video feature in FarCry 3 and haven't been able to make it lag. I'm very satisfied with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: ndh

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Card
customer_reviews.text: This was an excellent card, the only issue is that the boosted version went out about a month after I bought this but beside that I'm very happy with this item.
customer_reviews.author: Xavier Calderon

customer_reviews.title: Not the best value for the money.
customer_reviews.text: The 650 Ti is a good card, its nice for small cases or low end computers. However, for the money, you'll get much more performance out of an AMD Radeon 7850. Or for another 50 bucks, you can get a GTX 660 and worry less about upgrading in the future. Overall though, the card is quiet and does the job its supposed to.
customer_reviews.author: Shawn

customer_reviews.title: EVGA650TI 2 GB
customer_reviews.text: great value and wooks great VERY EFFICENT ITS GREAT FOR THE MOTHER BOARD ASUS77 I INSTALLED. I would recommend this to every one who cant spend a lot for a vedio card but still need a no glitch gameing card.
customer_reviews.author: Jim A. Stanfill

customer_reviews.title: Works better than expected!
customer_reviews.text: Just built my first gaming computer, but i was on a stricked $800 budget. This graphics card is a little monster! it handles any game i throw at it on max settings. arma 2, max settings runs at 20-25 frames, starcraft at 50-55 frames with not a lot of units on screen. arma 3 alpha... this is the game i bought this card for and it runs everything ultra with 25-30 frames. battlefield 3 runs a smooth 30-35 frames. these are all averages with the intel duo core i3-3220 @ 3.30GHz. I'm yet to make this thing lag. no crashes, good price, great performance! 5 stars!
customer_reviews.author: nemo

customer_reviews.title: strong and stable
customer_reviews.text: strong and stable: i recommend it for students who use graphic programs such as 3ds max +v-ray + Sony vigas.
customer_reviews.author: tackoi9003

customer_reviews.title: Best half size card
customer_reviews.text: was looking for a beefy card that would fit in my micro-itx case. This fit the bill. Rocking card. Would buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Spencer M Clegg

customer_reviews.title: The seller sent me a different brand video card in the box.
customer_reviews.text: There seems to be an intermittent double image that appears on my screen about every 2 or so mins. I had the video card professionally installed and the tech showed me that I there was actually a similar card sent to me in the EVGA box, but NOT the item that I had actually paid for. I didn't want to have to pay the tech to professionally install a card for the 2nd time so the glitchy card is still in my pc. :-(
customer_reviews.author: - XLR8 -

customer_reviews.title: Good card with a major flaw.
customer_reviews.text: Very good display with enough fps for all my games. Unfortunately, the noise the fan produces is simply unbearable. Have had it for over a year and it's just getting worse. Cleaning and removing the dust doesn't help. Would not buy it again.
customer_reviews.author: Xavi

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Intro Level Card
customer_reviews.text: This card does an excellent job handling modern games at 1080p, and can easily hold up against other competing cards. The Nvidia Physix, while not widely implemented, is a good addition to the card and worth the very small extra amount you pay for the addition of that power. The extra Gig of vram is well worth the extra $50 compared to the base GTX 650 ti, which I'm sure would have trouble playing Battlefield 3 and other Frostbite 2 powered games with only 1 GB of vram. An excellent buy for the $160 I paid for it.
customer_reviews.author: Arik Chadima

customer_reviews.title: Good performance, great price
customer_reviews.text: The card provides great performance, the price is reasonable and the card seems to be well constructed. The fan/heatsink assembly is on the big side, so it does take up two card slots (effectively).
customer_reviews.author: Faloi

customer_reviews.title: speedy shipment
customer_reviews.text: I got it as a gift for someone, very fast shipment very pleased with the service. I'm not a computer person so I don't really know how to review the actual product, As far as I know this is one of the best products that will enhance your gaming experience:)
customer_reviews.author: Debbie

customer_reviews.title: the best product in the world
customer_reviews.text: The experience is unique and true, I recommend to all fans. Expeiencia Live for yourself in this summer 2013. brilliant
customer_reviews.author: Junior Lora

customer_reviews.title: Experts Only
customer_reviews.text: I'm sure this video card has many, many wonderful features and I would appreciate those features IF I could muster up the expertise to install the driver. Installing a new video board is a task NOT for the faint of heart. The board works as a port to the integrated graphics on the motherboard, but has NONE of the features of an accelerated graphics processor. I feel as though I've wasted $170, but it serves as a hard-earned and expensive lesson that upgrading hardware on a desktop computer system should be left to EXPERTS ONLY.
customer_reviews.author: TnDon.

customer_reviews.title: these product before sending it to the recipient must try.
customer_reviews.text: this video card I never worked perfectly piede video is no longer used because it does not work..cuando you connect the monitor cable from the video goes and comes and does the same so far.
customer_reviews.author: cristhian martinez ureña

customer_reviews.title: love it
customer_reviews.text: i run 3 monitors and a tv. i already had one of these and my computer got bogged down a bit. im playing a movie on the screen, rendering video on 2 monitors and browsing online on the other.
customer_reviews.author: paul

product_meta.title: EVGA GeForce GTX 650 Ti 2048MB GDDR5 128bit, Dual Dual-Link DVI, Mini HDMI, Graphics Card (01G-P4-3651-KR) Graphics Cards 02G-P4-3651-KR
product_meta.description: If you’re passionate about first-person shooters like Call of Duty, massively multiplayer online games like World of WarCraft, or real-time strategy games like StarCraft II, then GeForce GTX is for you. Turbocharge your experience with the powerful performance of the EVGA GeForce GTX 650 Ti and enjoy the latest games in full 1080P HD with this next-generation NVIDIA Kepler architecture-based GPU.
feature_bullets: Nvidia SMX Engine, NVidia Adaptive Verticle Sync, Nvidia Surround, Support for Concurrent Displays, Nvidia PhysX, Nvidia 3D Vision Ready, Nvidia SLI Ready, Nvidia CUDA Technology
Microsoft DirectX 11, NVIDIA PhysX Technology, NVIDIA 3D Vision Ready, NVIDIA CUDA Technology, PCI-Express 3.0 Support, OpenGL 4.3 Support

specifications.Customer Reviews: 3.8 out of 5 stars73 ratings3.8 out of 5 stars
